channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.description: Take what you’ve learnt from WFH and push it into your working life post-pandemic, says a leading productivity coach.
item.title: Could our working lives have changed for the better?

item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Global COVID-19 cases surpass 5.5 million, Australian death toll stands at 102

item.description: A black man said he had asked a white woman to leash her dog in Central Park. She refused. Then the encounter, which was recorded on video, took an ugly turn.
item.title: White woman apologises for calling police on black bird watcher in Central Park

item.description: A top health expert is warning that the world is still in the very middle of the outbreak, dampening hopes for a speedy global economic rebound and renewed international travel.
item.title: WHO warns first wave of COVID-19 pandemic is not over

item.description: The new story, called The Ickabog, will be free to help entertain children and families stuck at home during the coronavirus pandemic.
item.title: J.K. Rowling publishes first chapters of new story online

item.description: The latest work by Sydney Morning Herald editorial cartoonist Cathy Wilcox.
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Cathy Wilcox

item.description: Gallery of illustrations by Sydney Morning Herald artist, Simon Letch.
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Simon Letch

item.description: Illustrations by the artist from The Age.
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Matt Golding

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, May 27, 2020

item.dc:creator: Farrah Tomazin
item.description: State secrecy has worsened since the Andrews government was elected, with damning new figures showing a decline in the release of information.
item.title: Victorian Premier under fire over state secrecy

item.dc:creator: Nick Galvin
item.description: Ten weeks after the contemporary arts festival was forced to close due to the coronavirus, it returns for a three-month run.
item.title: Biennale of Sydney awakens from its 10-week hibernation

item.dc:creator: Nick Toscano
item.description: Australia’s dependence on coal power is diminishing while renewable energy generation has passed a new record, new figures reveal.
item.title: Renewable energy eats into coal's share of electricity grid

item.dc:creator: Rob Harris
item.description: Medical students will be taught how to give basic mental health first aid as they respond to the extra stresses of the coronavirus pandemic.
item.title: Trainee doctors to receive specialist mental health first aid training

item.dc:creator: David Crowe
item.description: The Prime Minister has opened the door to significant industrial relations changes, but it will be up to employers to make their case.
item.title: Morrison's industrial relations push needs employers to make a case

item.dc:creator: Roy Masters
item.description: Peter V'landys has primed rugby league for the announcement of a reduced pay TV deal. But how will the clubs react if, as seems probable, the AFL is able to secure a superior result?
item.title: After softening-up period, stand by for big hits in TV rights stoush

item.dc:creator: Chris Uhlmann
item.description: The JobKeeper gaffe is a political weapon the opposition can use to kneecap the government.
item.title: Labor has been handed a rare gift but it might not be the last

item.description: The grandson of a Stanley Cup star says the sports world must learn from history after the second wave of Spanish flu's fatal effect on the 1919 final series.
item.title: History lesson: The deadly cost of rushing back to sports after a pandemic

item.dc:creator: Garry Maddox
item.description: The 21-year-old Australian actor has had her first short selected for the virtual edition of the Sydney Film Festival next month.
item.title: With a film about a strange online trend, Little Women's Eliza Scanlen makes festival debut

item.dc:creator: Carrie Fellner
item.description: Experts have expressed alarm about a self-regulation system for new chemicals coming into Australia with fears it could unleash the next toxic chemical disaster.
item.title: 'Disaster in the making': Industry to decide safe chemicals code

item.dc:creator: Tom Rabe
item.description: The new social distancing squad will be the eyes and ears of the NSW government, trying to prevent a new COVID-19 outbreak through passengers catching crowded public transport.
item.title: Social distancing squad armed with 11,000 cameras monitoring Sydney's trains

item.description: The smell of exhaust drives me nuts - and right now it is everywhere.
item.title: I have a message for knuckle-dragging engine-running bastards who keep their cars idling

item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Knight
item.description: At last count 159 companies have withdrawn financial year 2020 guidance and some are using it as an opportunity (or cover) to fix pre-existing issues.
item.title: Removing corporate trash under the cover of COVID

item.description: Free daily horoscope for each star sign from renowned Astrologer Hedy Damari. Forecasts for the day ahead in life, love and career.
item.title: Your Daily Horoscope for Wednesday, May 27

item.dc:creator: Lydia Lynch
item.description: A Queensland senator has accused the federal government of "co-ordinating an attack" on Premier Annastacia Palaszczuk's border closures ahead of the state election in October.
item.title: Senator accuses federal coalition of 'co-ordinated attack' over Qld border

item.dc:creator: Roy Ward
item.description: The WNBL will start its season in late November in the hope it can have fans back in stadiums after Christmas, but key decisions on imports and broadcasters are yet to be announced.
item.title: WNBL to push back start date but still play full season

item.description: With conspiracy theories selling faster than hotcakes, you can see why former chef Pete Evans is making the switch.
item.title: How COVID-19 is driving a booming conspiracy industry

item.dc:creator: Simon Johanson
item.description: A medical clinic on Canterbury Road has been sold in an off-market deal for just under $4 million.
item.title: Investor snaps up medical clinic for $4m

item.dc:creator: Emma Koehn
item.description: The agency that oversees My Health Record is inviting app developers to connect but experts have warned of security implications.
item.title: Security concerns raised as My Health Record provider works with app developers

item.description: Employers have a part to play in helping to fix an underfunded and ad hoc training system that has suffered with the decline of TAFE.
item.title: Employers can help repair broken training system

item.dc:creator: Lucy Stone
item.description: A pre-1911 house in Manly in Brisbane's bayside won't be demolished purely because of its age, a court has ruled.
item.title: How a 115-year-old mortgage helped save a bayside home

item.description: Just as Australia needs to foster relations with countries other than China, the library is cutting back on its Asian collecting.
item.title: Out of Asia: the National Library shuts borders and stops collecting on our neighbours

item.description: In shops, hotels, airports, offices, and homes across the country, Australians watched as Schapelle Corby's fate was sealed in a Balinese court room.
item.title: From the Archives, 2005: The face that stopped a nation

item.dc:creator: Simon Johanson
item.description: A proposed East Melbourne office's “fatally flawed” design has complicated philanthropist and Flight Centre co-founder Geoff Harris’ plans.
item.title: Flawed office complicates Flight Centre founder's philanthropy

item.dc:creator: Jacqui Martinez
item.description: Hidden power stations, ticket machines for trams, buses and women's cricket not nice.
item.title: In the Herald: May 27, 1949

item.description: I thought I had overcome the conspiracy mindset that once consumed me. Cue COVID-19.
item.title: Why am I drawn to conspiracy theories? I have a theory

item.dc:creator: Carolyn Cummins
item.description: The retail landlord hopes to ease the concerns of consumers coming out of their coronavirus hibernation.
item.title: Stockland launches personal shopping services in malls

item.dc:creator: Michaela Whitbourn
item.description: The state of NSW has attempted to use tough anti-terror laws against Aboriginal men imprisoned for other crimes.
item.title: NSW government using anti-terror laws against Indigenous men jailed for other offences

item.description: Trivia buffs: test your knowledge with today's interactive superquiz and target.
item.title: Target and superquiz, Wednesday, May 27

item.dc:creator: Samantha Hutchinson
item.description: Sarah Henderson took the nuclear option in the battle against pesky Twitter trolls last week, filing defamation proceedings in court. But her colleagues aren't happy.
item.title: Never mind Sharma, Hendo's going nuclear

item.dc:creator: Chip Le Grand
item.description: Protective gowns which cost less than $2 before the coronavirus outbreak are now fetching more than $13, while nasal swabs have gone from 50¢ to $3 a pop.
item.title: 'Carpetbaggers and snake oil sellers' hike prices on COVID-19 essentials

item.dc:creator: Ella Archibald-Binge
item.description: Twenty years after an iconic walk for reconciliation, Linda Burney fears there is not enough political will to achieve the next phase of Indigenous recognition.
item.title: Indigenous voice ‘fundamental’ to reconciliation, says Linda Burney

item.dc:creator: Nick Dyrenfurth
item.description: The Coalition government wants to get everyone back in the room together, but can it transcend ideology and make this a reality?
item.title: 'Put your weapons down': Co-operation is the future for workplaces

item.dc:creator: Cara Waters
item.description: Owners of treasured Block Arcade cafe the Hopetoun Tea Rooms are devastated after failed expansion dreams compounded by the coronavirus lockdown left the business drowning in debt.
item.title: Famous Melbourne cake shop for sale after business collapse

item.dc:creator: Clancy Yeates
item.description: Shareholder advocates say the government's changes to corporate disclosure rules gives boards an "honest idiot defence"
item.title: 'Honest idiot' disclosure rules will threaten investor confidence, critics warn

item.description: The finest photos from the international wire agencies as chosen by our picture editors.
item.title: The best of the world in pictures

item.description: With the path out of the pandemic looking clearer, the future doesn't look as bad as it did two months ago.
item.title: Rising sharemarket still has some steam left in it

item.dc:creator: John Collett
item.description: Taxpayers have more choice over how they claim home office expenses in their tax returns this year and making the right choice could put some extra cash in your pocket.
item.title: Keeping a diary could boost your tax refund

item.dc:creator: David Crowe
item.description: Scott Morrison sought ACTU secretary Sally McManus' opinion last week before announcing his push to reform industrial relations.
item.title: Unions get a seat at Scott Morrison's workplace reform table

item.dc:creator: Nick Bonyhady
item.description: Diego Franco, the sole income earner for his wife and 11-month-old daughter, delivered food via motorbike for the company for about three years until he was dismissed last month.
item.title: 'Booted off the app': Deliveroo driver challenges dismissal

item.dc:creator: Anthony Galloway
item.description: Senior foreign policy officials are concerned Victoria's deal could undermine Australia's push to counter Beijing's growing influence in the region.
item.title: 'Flagrantly reckless': Victoria signed China infrastructure deal without consulting DFAT
